intro: Phthirusa pedicularis, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its leaves are often succulent, aiding in water retention, while the flowers are usually pink or white. Phthirusa pedicularis is often found in rocky soils and is a component of various Mediterranean and temperate ecosystems.
